job_title: Senior Student and Family Success Coach in Pasadena, CA
pros: This company stands behind what they do, not just for its students, but also employees. Regardless of the department you work in, you feel welcome, accepted, and heard.
cons: Ive been here for over a year, and still enjoy every day working here.

review_title: Take it for what it is
job_title: A Former Employee in Pasadena, CA
pros: Honestly I want to stay humble, I grateful I was able to work there for as long as I did. Co-workers are great, they will help you survive. If you want to take a chance, on this place it is your choice. But I would be very cautious on the 5 star ratings on this platform, the current President will have his department heads leave great reviews. I would read some of the bad with the good, then make a choice before proceeding with Pacific Oaks. It is the staff that makes the culture worth it.
cons: The benefits are leverage against why there will be no raises. Constant cutback on simple things like coffee. Some department heads are great to work with and then there are others you should always cc'd your direct lead on. Do not trust the Head of HR.

pros: The school is non-profit and has an excellent reputation overall.
cons: The management in the admissions department lacks communication and training for employees looking to move up in management roles. Management addressed the team with a lousy attitude and kept information from team members. The department lacked training for potential growth. Many employees complained about the same person to HR, and nothing was ever addressed. The department has a high turnover.

review_title: Some nice people,  high turnover rate, messy leadership
pros: Every potential employee meets with the president, at least this is the case at the Pasadena location. The employees truly care about their work and there is an authentic focus on uplifting ehtnic minorities, women, and working adults.
cons: The management is sloppy, the pay is low, and the turn-over rate is high within leadership positions. When I began my position there, the existing leadership had only been in place for 6 months, meaning nearly all of the staff positions had recently been filled. I was meant to work directly with students, but the number of students enrolled and on-site was greatly exaggerated, and I spent a lot of my time sitting around with nothing to do.

pros: Everyone actually believes in the colleges core values and you can see it in they way they respect each other and the students. During the pandemic, the college made sure laptops were available for every employee so they could keep their jobs while so many other places were shutting down. It would have been easier and saved money to lay off all but essential staff but leadership really cared about making sure the employees were safe and able to keep their income and take care of their families. Instead of making all the students just go online, they trained the professors on virtual classroom instruction and the campus students were able to continue their classes in a virtual setup mid-semester without missing a beat. The thought and consideration for taking care of staff and students was really apparent. I love this place.
cons: It’s a really small school so employees tend to wear a lot of hats. In a way it’s good because new staff get exposed to more and have more learning opportunities than at bigger schools but it does mean everyone has a lot of responsibility and it can be tough for some to keep up if they are just in it for a paycheck and don’t care about the mission of the college.

pros: Pacific oaks has a very strong focus on social justice issues in all the departments.
cons: It has been difficult not teaching in person during the COVID-19 pandemic, and a bit isolating.

job_title: Associate Marriage and Family Therapist in Highland Park, CA
pros: Experience - if you’re looking to get experience with teaching
cons: The pay is really low

pros: People really care about their roles and students.
cons: There was constant changes in leadership and turnover in staff was continuous.

pros: Great work life balance. Company really cares about mission to the community.
cons: Little to none career growth.

review_title: Toxic, High Stress, High Turnover, Tumultuous History
pros: This place must have been good once. It was in danger of closing several years ago. Many faculty are very passionate (however a lot have left recently).
cons:
Leadership at PO and at System is abusive. This place is a degree mill - for profit (UofP, Argosy, etc) leadership techniques under the guise of a non-profit. Their mission and the way they treat their students (and employees) is conflicting. 
There is constant turnover - registrar, credential specialist, leadership at Children's School, admissions staff, presidents, deans, faculty, etc. This place is a revolving door.  
Children's School was operating for years  over its licensed capacity (further exemplifying that leadership pays to need to rules and just wants numbers and money). 
There is no communication and little collaboration between departments. Information is hoarded.  There is a lack of clarity around strategies, priorities, etc. Brown nosers and unethical behavior rule. Bullying is an acceptable (and praised) behavior. 
Numbers rule - there is an obsession with metrics- daily and hourly. Employees are not treated as multifaceted producers. 
The tuition for this place is crazy based upon the programs they offer.  They take advantage of low income first gen students, single moms, etc. saddle them with thousands of dollars of debt. The earning potential for these degree programs is such that these students will never be able to pay off these loans. 
There have been several programmatic accreditation issues. 
Yelp reviews from students aren't complimentary either.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in San Jose, CA
pros: The pay is really good, starts at $25 an hour. The job is very easy to learn and easy to do. Some travel benefits too. Also the faculty are some of the kindest and hardest working people there are. They are frankly the only saving grace for this college.
cons: They don't care about social justice at all. It comes up a lot on their website but is not a part of their culture at all. Furthermore, all they care about is numbers. They track EVERYTHING you do from number of phone calls you make every day to the notes you take on them. All they care is that you make enough calls and enroll enough students, even if it means pushing a student who may not be ready. They preach "we just want what is best for the student" but all they care about is their numbers and getting enough students to make money. There are also endless meetings every week and you are micro-managed endlessly.  The degrees are insanely expensive and you can get the same/better programs for less money at other colleges. I can go on but that sums it up.

pros: The location of the school is great. You are right next to downtown Pasadena and their wonderful resturants and places to shop.
cons: There is no room for advancement. They would tell people that they are being promoted and give them new job titles but people were forced to keep the same pay.  The school was bought by the The Chicago School of Professional Psychology.  TCS has just recently fired many employees and Pacific oaks has fired many of their employees also.  Many new people were hired but are not qualified for their job.  They run the school like telemarketing business not like a place school

review_title: A Great & Unique Place to Work
pros:
-Inclusive work environment
-Strong sense of community
-Copious amounts of respect & appreciation 
-Opportunities for growth within the organization
-The best work events ever
-Very mindful of and responsive to employee concerns 
-Intentional about making sure salaries are competitive compared to "market value"
-Very down-to-earth President & executive staff
cons: -Increases come in the form of bonuses instead of actual salary increases

pros: Many of the employees work really hard and are dedicated to serving students; it is a family environment.
cons: Leadership is not honest and a big part of people leaving, especially now; leadership also takes advantage of the dedication of some employees and pushes them to a point where work life balance is nonexistant.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in San Jose, CA
pros: Classes at night and on the weekends are great for people who work full time.
cons: The administrative side is chaotic and poorly organized. Most importantly, as an instructor, I had a student who, according to Pacific Oaks guidelines, should not have passed my class. When I attempted to enforce the policy I was told, "Pass her- we need her tuition money." I personally would never hire anyone who got their degree here because it's not a real degree. If students are routinely passed who don't deserve to be, the academic integrity of the institution is a joke.

pros: In hopes that new blood can keep this great institution afloat, bring it back to the incredible history of many years gone by.
cons: Unfortunately for the past 14+ yrs this incredible school has gone through some tragic transitions. The past admin dragged it through the mud. The future of this once great institution feels very unstable.

job_title: Pat Meda Supervisor in Pasadena, CA
pros: you are able to work on homework in detailed when you are on your lunch break because  of the campus is not busy until 4:00p.m
cons: Your class mates may not be on campus when your there because of the different areas of life that we are in and age.

review_title: Stressful  Corporate approach for a nonprofit !!!!    Intoxicated environment
pros: Non-close the door of this so-called  educational institution .
cons: Incompetent  President  it's all about money ,  they  backstab you if you stand up for what's right  ,

review_title: One of the best job opportunities and professional growth path of my career
pros: Diversity value, great employment package, strong community comittment to values & mission, good work/life balance, advancement opportunities
cons: Lackness of standardized policies and procedures, faculty-administration relationship challenges, transitions.

pros: Organization makes concerted effort to include employee views/ideas when creating policy.  Pay is competitive, and benefits package a big plus.  Access to upper management (administration) is easy, very open-door.
cons: Sometimes the downside of gathering input from everyone means that you end up in more meetings.

pros: the small size, proximity to DT Pasadena if on campus, some staff members are very warm, free parking lot if on campus, easy access to technology.
cons: management, lack of clear organization, too many faculties are changing a lot, very little to no control over syllabus, difficult to manage conflicts.

pros: The staff is great, the mission is inspiring, and helping student achieve their educational goals.
cons: The job was not a full time position.

pros: Work in a place that values social justice and humanity and puts student success first!
cons: Sometimes slow to change. Going through growing "pains."

review_title: beware of borderline unethical management, incompetent leaderships, high turnover
pros: you learn what not to do in management. helped me with personal growth and values.
cons: too many to list. this is truly a sad and fear based place to work.
